document_data.mainbody:
ardrella “Bloodmaiden” Blawdul was a pirate and a writer, active in the late 14 century DR.
By the , the Bloodmaiden had spent ten years at sea as a pirate who survived sea serpents, shipwrecks, and Umberlees wrathful storms. In 1391 DR, she published an autobiography book that collected her musings and experiences. Black Blades at Sunset Ten Years a Pirate had a notable declaration that Vardrella preferred "honest" life of a pirate in the perilous sea over lording in a big city, surrounded by bootlickers, backstabbers, and liars.
